website_summaries.verdict: The DYMO LabelManager 500TS label printer can connect to a computer to print labels, but its touch screen and QWERTY keyboard make it easy to print without one.
pros: Prints from a computer or as a standalone labeler
cons: Hard to control scrolling through long lists, making it easy to skip over the items you're looking for

customer_reviews.title: DYMO LabelManager 500TS - Not quite there
customer_reviews.text: The buttons don't press cleanly and they get stuck, and the touch screen isn't consistently responsive. Often I'd press a key and nothing would show up on the screen, so I'd have to press a key several times to get it to register the letter I'd pressed. Label makers are supposed to be convenient and labor-saving, but for this one it's not worth the hassle of having to jam on the buttons all the time. Seems like better DYMO technology could fix this model up in a next generation, but skip this one - it's too big and clunky to be convenient and too small and finicky to be comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Caryatid

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Polished Outside, cheap insides...
customer_reviews.text: PoliThis thing seems to be simply a cash grab. It works well for a short while, but after some moderate use, it'll never work well again. I'm into my second month of owning this & i'm constantly cleaning the print head, but to no avail. Large streaks & poor print quality plague all my labels as of late no matter how thoroughly i try to clean it. I suspect that customer service will ask me to send it in for repairs for an exuberant price.
customer_reviews.author: Petros A. Papantoniou

customer_reviews.title: Too Bad It Doesn't Work Most of the Time
customer_reviews.text: It printed 10 labels and quit working (software issue). I had to spend 1 hour on phone with customer service before it started working again. Printed another 15 or 20 labels and quit working again. I don't have the time to work with such a touchy product. If it doesn't work, it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Sue Kafieh

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer - wasted space
customer_reviews.text: Conceptually the product is good. However, I needed a printer that didn't add such a long lead (spaces) before and after the words. We have a tight space for the labels and have to manually cut the labels down to get rid of the wasted space.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item! This has been amazing for making labels for our office files! Easy to use. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Madona S.

customer_reviews.title: Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: Many label makers out there but this is a excellent label maker for a great price.plenty of nice features.Can use a couple of different size tapes,can change fonts and font size,can be used with a computer or without.Great product to have if you need to make a quick label.
customer_reviews.author: Freddyd

customer_reviews.title: Nice Label Manager
customer_reviews.text: I like this DYMO, it works great. I would have given it five stars but the touch screen is a little hard to use. Still love all the functionality and the selection of tape sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Constantly have to power cycle it in order to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Constantly have to power cycle it in order to get it to work, especially when using it without the power cord plugged in and the battery does not last very long at all
customer_reviews.author: Donald Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased a similar maker from Home Depot and it was too heavy and industrial for our purposes. This has a decent sized screen and easy to push buttons. Our first delivered machine had a button that didn't want to push correctly - the company sent me a new one quickly after contacting. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: OritionX

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this, but this could have been made better
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, but this could have been made better. Slow to turn on (irritating for quick labeling when I'm used to the cheaper model), have to press hard on some of the buttons to get it to register, touch screen isn't great, doesn't fit in your hands as nicely as their other units, navigation and screen space optimization leave something to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: A guy

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Label Maker Out There
customer_reviews.text: Solid unit and very reliable. I have used DYMO Label Makers before and this one, for the dollars, packs way more functions into this machine. Excellent screen, very vivid. High quality labels. I would highly recommend this Label Maker.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it... Plug n Play.. Very easy to create and edit labels. Saved them for later right on the 500TS...
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS FIRST AND THINK 🤔 ABOUT IT 😉
customer_reviews.text: Best Label Maker Ever. But the down fall is the touch screen poorly works👎. Tape can print defective prints👎. The color of screen is amazing but❤️, it’s not the greatest technology👎. Should never made it touch screen👎. I would have made non-touch screen👍. It if was not touch it would be a hell a lot better 4 stars👍. Last complaint and final the power button is touchy-feely👎. This could be redone could make serious money👍. When prints it’s ver fancy looking and cuts the tape automatically 👍
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bird

customer_reviews.title: label maker
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to say I have not used this or any of the accessories yet, but I will update review when I get it up and running. It looks like it will be a great machine so I am only giving it 3 stars until I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Blersch

customer_reviews.title: It's great I guess.
customer_reviews.text: I love labeling things and was so happy to receive this label maker. Within a day I was severely disappointed though, when I attempted to label Oliver and it wouldn't adhere. I guess I'll give it five stars though. Whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Fn Vicious

customer_reviews.title: Short life, throw away unit
customer_reviews.text: The long life battery lasted less than two years, it refuses to print without a new battery, and the replacement battery (which come from China so you know it's high quality, really expensive) costs more than the unit. Consider this a THROW AWAY unit in less than two years. More usage may very well deplete the battery sooner. I am still on the first label cartridge, making only an occasional label here and there. You battery is only made by Dymo, so forget finding a cheap replacement or using off the shelf batteries. Its a real oddball.
customer_reviews.author: sloop

customer_reviews.title: MISLEADING DESCRIPTION - NOT USB RECHARGABLE
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed as soon as I open the box. This is not rechargeable buy a USB even though all the pictures show it as such, and the text alludes to it. This has a separate problem charger you have to use. As someone who really could use a rechargeable labeler in the field, I was really hoping this would be a good solution. Instead, it just turned out to be more stuff that was going to get lost or cables I didn’t need to lug around and lose. Batteries make more logistical sense.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and lacking features and characters
customer_reviews.text: I spent 60 bucks more for this than the brother I was going to buy. My old rectangular brother machine worked well and had a awsd keyboard that was easy to.type on.l, had an automatic cutter, and wasted less tape. On top of that the brother tape layers plastic over the substrate to create a more durable label. Additionally this is missing characters, and the labels fall off with outdoor use, which is not.the case with even generic brother labels. This is less useful in every way but portability for a higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan J. Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Battery DOA
customer_reviews.text: As others have warned, the batteries for these Dymo units quite apparently do not last. The battery for the unit I received was dead-on-arrival! The unit declared, in large font, "Battery Failure!" when I inserted the battery, plugged it in, and tried to power it on. I'll be returning it, as this was definitely confirmation of the other reviews here.
customer_reviews.author: Eidolways

customer_reviews.title: No AC Adapter !!!!!!!!!! I'm mad !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't hate the product, what I really hate are manufacturers that will not include any AC adapter not any batteries. That's a really bad way to do business, what's the point of using it if there's no power cord, what about if you don't have any batteries then you are left to go to the store to get some new batteries. Will send it right back and demand my money. Don't buy this product, don't recommend it, and also don't settle for it if you have batteries. Call Dyno and demand that they send you an AC adapter or get your full refund.... Bad way to do business
customer_reviews.author: Josue Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great for Daycare Labels
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good label maker to label my child's belongings and bottles/cups for daycare. So far, this thing has been worth every penny. It is easy to use and the labels seem to be waterproof and like they will hold up well. It certainly helps me keep things looking more organized and I like that the label maker has different font size options. Highly recommend for the casual user.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a whim and would highly recommend! Almost everything from clothes, cleaning supplies, blankets, towels, files, electronics, tools, office supplies and toys now have a designated place making things super easy to locate. I cannot understate how this little unassuming device has suprisingly improved my home life. No more shuffling around looking for things, buying duplicates because things got lost in a messy drawer or bin, or constantly cleaning clutter. This also keeps my family accountable for putting things back where they belong. 1,000 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Love the case concept with everything you need to begin doing labels!
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker and that it comes in a nice case with batteries, power adapter, and 2 cartridges. I used it first to label the filters and replacement date in my new fridge. I really like the yellow labels with black lettering, very easy to read and stand out nicely. I gave this 4 stars because of the display being a bit hard to read depending on your lighting situation. I think if the character darkness and boldness was improved I would give it 5 stars easy! The label maker does what it’s supposed to and makes a very crisp lettered label.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Arlaud

customer_reviews.title: wrong product image, annoying spec issues
customer_reviews.text: Amazon listed the smaller device image on the posting - I got a bigger device with more features than I was expecting and luckily it used the labels I ordered separately, BUT this requires a NOT PROVIDED usb micro B charging cable to use and that is just a bit of toss when you're out in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Erik A. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for a label maker to better organize my nail polish swatch sticks as well as other craft supplies. After looking at some more expensive options I settled for this and for the price point I'm very impressed (and it's actually gone down a couple of dollars since my purchase). It prints cleanly and the device is pretty intuitive, though if you're struggling you can find the manual at the Dymo website. Batteries are not included nor is the compatible ac adapter. It does however come with a sample roll of tape. All the labels in the photo, give or take a few practice labels and typos, were printed using the sample roll!
customer_reviews.author: Yesica B

customer_reviews.title: Label jam error... returning the item...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I guess I got a bad unit... pulled it out of the box... put in the battery, plugged it to the electricity to charge the battery... waited for an hour to charge it... put in the label cartridge, turned it on... wrote the word “Test” then as soon (almost instantly) as I pushed the print button... there is a message saying that there is a label jam and needed to remove the cartridge... I removed it... checked it... read the instructions about 20 times... and nothing... the same message... it sucks!! Went online and see if there are videos so I can fix the problem... there are videos... followed them... nothing... Im returning the item...
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this one!!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this, I would’ve given it 5 stars. Worked great and was easy to use. Not sure what happened but now it won’t print a thing. Contacted Dymo and got instructions on how to clean the print head, which wasn’t even the slightest bit dirty. I’ve tried everything I know how to do with out destroying the printer. Wound up tossing it since it’s past time to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M Gates-Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Not so great :(
customer_reviews.text: The label-maker does everything that one would expect but when it comes to the labels actually adhering to the surfaces of objects (i.e. bottles, small containers, etc.) it fails miserably. Note: I did manage to clean the surfaces before adhering and they still fall off even on smooth surfaces. So to sum it up, here are pros and cons: Pros: - easy to use - prints well - handheld - wireless - has capability to charge with an AC charger Cons: - labels peel off easily and don’t adhere long - requires 6 AAA batteries - does not come with an AC charger - bulky
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Castro

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few different label makers throughout the years and this has been my favorite so far. For me I find it to be very user friendly. I love how easy it is to find the right letters/numbers/symbols. I've had it for about a year now, have never had any printing jams or anything like I've had on previous label makers I've owned. Also I love how you can recharge it without having to buy batteries, that's a big time plus for me. Honestly idk how I could give this less than 5 stars, that what it deserves.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward- great starter label maker!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want anything with a bunch of fancy bells and whistles, but I wanted it to be reliable and produce quality labels. This was easy to use right out of the box- although fully charging is recommended first. I purchased a cartridge of white print on black tape and I love it! I’ll update as I learn more features, although I’ve gotta say I actually enjoy the limited features for simplicity’s sake. Not too many fonts, the three preloaded are cute and versatile. I can’t wait to label everything!
customer_reviews.author: jj1013

customer_reviews.title: Used for my makeup travel jars!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I wanted to condense my travel accessories and beauty products but the permanent oil markers (recommended by a lot of Amazon reviews but still didn't cut the bill) would come off with the alcohol or creams in my face creams. (See photo for wear) Anyhow, I bought small plastic containers and the clear with black font 1/4" tapes. Works beautifully! Now I won't have to guess at what product is in the containers. I also love that I can use any font I've downloaded. (Dafont.com for free awesome fonts). The containers I used::  All in all, I love this and totally recommend it. Now I'm off to go label my kitchen containers !
customer_reviews.author: queenpineberryTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Dymo LabelManager 160
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Dymo LabelManager 160. On a product page that lists several different models, it's important to state which one are you reviewing. I bought it sale for $9.99 (which occur pretty often). It has a full qwerty keyboard which is nice, special characters are not easily accessible (only thorough menu button). Font size ranges 8-24 points. It has Bold, Italic, 5 underlining and outlining options and it can print vertically. It can print 2 lines with up to 12 points font size. It uses 6 AAA batteries (not provided) or a 9V/2A power supply (that is not provided either). They sell it at Fry's for $34.99, crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Tal A.

customer_reviews.title: Screen is shockingly bad
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews, so I knew the screen wouldn't be great. Yet, the dimness of screen still shocked me once I received it. If I place it directly under a task light and shift things around to get the angle right it's just usable. It's hard to believe someone at Dymo looked at this and said, "ship it". Yet, apparently they did. It's too bad, as it ruins an otherwise perfectly good device.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Dymo LM 210D Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Terrible screen on this label writer. You have to twist and angle in various positions to see the screen. I previously had the Dymo model 160 which recently died after very little use. Didn't learn my lesson so purchased this model which is a very good kit if the LM 210 had a screen you could see. I debated on whether to keep because I don't regularly use a label writer. However, after struggling to see the screen, I'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: JStreet

customer_reviews.title: Older "D1" tapes will not work with this
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing for 2 reasons: 1) I was looking forward with this truly being PnP. Sadly, PnP did not work with my iMac (with Catalina OS0. It simply was not recognized. Lots of discussion about work-arounds in a web search - I should not have to do that to make it work. 2) Dymo has changed the physical shape of the "D1" tape cartridge while keeping the same name! I have a small fortune invested in tapes from my many-years-old Dymo printer. Were I to be keeping this, I would have to buy them all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: It prints nice labels with some issues.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: It prints nice labels. CONS: It's a trial to get the backing off the label. The display screen is very difficult to see except straight on and with a bright light. The navigation button doesn't always respond. The "Clear" button doesn't seem to do anything. While the Amazon product description does not mention "Clip Art", the packaging states it has 200+ clip art images - It does NOT. When I contacted DYMO, their reply was that the punctuation and math symbols and such were "clip art" - That's punctuation and math symbols - That's deceptive and it isn't Clip Art.
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: I'm in IT field for 20+ years and I CANNOT connect it to any of my machines My $3K plus gaming PC states does not recognize this laptop and neither are the 2 laptops i tried this on Dymo Connect application only has a "Virtual Printer" in it and theres no way to change it I also went and manually added the label maker as a printer but DYMO software still doesnt see it. Tried it all different ways on 3 windows 10 PCs and no luck
customer_reviews.author: DroFamily

customer_reviews.title: I did extensive research and this one cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing LabelMaker. It came with the carrying case, the LabelMaker, extra tapes, Batteries And the AC adapter! The price was really good considering it comes with everything you need and seldom does that happen. The other great thing about this label makers it doesn’t leave huge gaps at the beginning and the end of your label so that’s wasting tape. I Did extensive research reading reviews, asking people and figuring out exactly what I needed the LabelMaker to do. Then to find the item with all those accessories included! You can’t beat the price or the reviews for this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: some of these reviews seemed really iffy, but i think this is so easy. im not sure where to get more paper whenever i run out but that is my only issue so far! i think it is so easy and it doesn't waste paper to me. you have to "cut" it when it is done printing and there is a button for that, and then you pull it out. i don't use this super frequently so it might not be amazing for you if you are doing a lot (like a teacher maybe??) but it is perfect for me. i randomly label holiday bins or other storage things and it is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: I am a Dymo Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Dymo products for over 50 years. I remember my high school teacher in the 1970's got one for the classroom to label things. The tape was plastic, but it worked well. Now, many years later, the tech has changed, but the product is still very reliable. I have always recommended Dymo to all I know for what it does. What can I say, I stick with what works.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker - does it all
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews, but this label maker prompted me to, it really does it all and at very reasonable cost. Best features are it recharges off your USB or off the AC charger (which is included) and so never needs batteries. Once you figure it out (simple) you are off to the races. I've used the downloaded DYMO desktop application as well where the LabelMaker functions as basically a connected printer for storing label text and using some odd size fonts and all, another great feature. It uses the label tape efficiently, and generic refills are available, so no drawback there. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Andy O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable.....WARNING: External power supply requires a center negative pinout
customer_reviews.text: ~DYMO Label Maker | LabelManager 160 Portable Label Maker~ Easy enough to use, but the last one I used was the old mechanical style with rigid plastic labels, so I'm not a good reference to its' use. You'll need the external power supply since the six AAA batteries drain too fast. The unit is marked as requiring 9VDC @ 2.0A & center negative (with a 2.1mm barrel jack). The most common pinout on DC power supplies is center positive, this unit requires a center negative. I have a 9VDC @ 1.5A power supply that I switched the polarity on the barrel plug & it works.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Temporary Use Only...
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for over a year. I put it in storage after two months. After a few months in storage, it wouldn't work. It doesn't seem to charge; and the battery has no available replacement. I don't know why they wouldn't use rechargeable AA batteries instead of this proprietary pack. The 12 volt power adapter isn't standard either; so if you don't find the special adapter supplied; you're done. I consider this a loss.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Kim

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t turn on.
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first one back in 2016, using it with an AC adaptor (9V 2A bought separately). I need to push power button twice to turn it on but otherwise worked fine. I needed a new one for home use so I bought again in 2020. Received it quickly but it wouldn’t turn on with the AC adaptor (same one). Returned it, Amazon sent me a replacement. Tried again. Nope, doesn’t work. Either Amazon is selling all the returned defective ones or Dymo just doesn’t even try with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Chung

customer_reviews.title: JUNE 2019 - 2 Dymo Label Maker - failures verified by Dymo/manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased first one in May 2019. Defective. LABEL JAM error. Contacted Dymo tech support, went through troubleshooting and determined it was defective. Amazon sent a replacement. Second Dymo received in June 2019. Again, defective. LABEL JAM error. Contacted Dymo tech support, went through troubleshooting and determined this 2nd one was also defective. The Dymo tech support agent also noted that this LABEL JAM error has been a systemic issue, that he is seeing this quite often, and that the only way after basic trouble shooting doesn't work is to send it in and get a replacement. Whatever manufacturing issues they're having, its a system wide one, affecting a lot of people. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Achilles heal: requires battery that fails
customer_reviews.text: Initially, this was of dubious value. I had to open special software to format and print to it, so I could do that faster using a standalone label maker. I used not very often. I thought I would give it another chance a while back and couldn't get it to work. Flashing blue light. Tried again now and finally figured out the LiON battery it has is required and has failed and it is more than half the price of the printer! Guess it will go in the trash. What poor design to have a plug-in item that requires a battery. I guess they plan that as their profit center. Not playing.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Heitkamp

customer_reviews.title: Not worthy of one star
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Dymo 160 in 2018, but with caring for my 94 year old mother who has since passed away, I didn't have a chance to use it till today, February 21, 2019. Wouldn't you know, six new batteries, a new tape cartridge, looking at YouTube fix it videos, 2 hours later and can't clear the "label jam" message. It has never printed a single label and likely never will. Too long ago for me to request a refund, but I wasted my money and with the number of requests I saw on line to figure out how to fix it, if you purchase it, you will have wasted your money too. :-(
customer_reviews.author: TLA

customer_reviews.title: Jams
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a while ago. Just finished my first cartridge. I have had 2 lable jams, and the cartridge ended up wrapping the ink ribbon around the wheel. First jam was some label itself. Not hard to fix. Second jam, which apparently happened as I tried to clear the ink ribbon off the "drive wheel". I found a small piece of plastic in one of the gears, no big deal. But still jammed. I know Dymo is a good brand. I plan to buy a different model to replace this one. Just avoid this model. Look around online. There are a LOT of people.talking about this model jamming up.
customer_reviews.author: f. lastname

customer_reviews.title: The over 6000k reviews are NOT for this LM-210D model! AMAZON should fix this, it’s deceiving!
customer_reviews.text: Product is very poorly made out of cheap plastic. The buttons don’t have a very confident click to them. The one I got was defective, could barely see the letters on screen and contrast adjustment didn’t make a difference. The case is pretty cool but if you want a label maker you’ll be happy with, get the LM-160, my wife has it and mine is on the way. I just had to return this one. Got a case, 2 tapes, AC adapter, and label maker for ~$53, not much more but much much better. BTW, this comes with starter black on white and a full black on yellow cartridge in case you were wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Zeferino

customer_reviews.title: Not made very well
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Dymo Label Manager 160 to have died a premature death on me. This one would not work out-of-the-box and was returned, powered on but every attempt at use ended with "Label Jam" error despite multiple cartidge changes and battery changes. The previous versions first stopped printing despite fresh batteries and/or cartridge, then would not even power-up after about a year of home use. I previously had DYMO labelers that worked flawlessly for years, so not sure what changed, but the quality is no longer very good and this product is not anything I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: ORDER EXTRA ROLLS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first label maker and I really really like it. My main complaint is the roll provided with the machine is extremely short!!! Had I known that I would have ordered extra rolls when I ordered the machine. I was just getting started labeling all my parts containers when it ran out. Now, I'm stuck waiting two days and won't be able to spend time doing the rest of it until next week. MAKE THAT CLEAR SO PEOPLE KNOW TO ORDER EXTRA. The machine is very easy to use, buttons feel good (high quality) and the labeler works great, very quiet. Really, really wish I could keep working today on this project!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BbReviewTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Its a label printer
customer_reviews.text: I think the labels have too much wasted space before and after the text and there is no way to adjust that. It is a very basic label printer and for the money its a good deal. User interface is a bit hokey as you have to use a menu to utilize symbols like hyphens (-), unlike others i have used in the past where they are accessible via a ctrl key and the main keyboard. But its cheap and if you are only printing a few labels here and there it is sufficient. If you are printing many labels per day look for something with symbols on the main keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: GrizzlyAdams

customer_reviews.title: Battery Issues
customer_reviews.text: Similar to other users the Label Manager 160 doesn't seem to work on rechargeable batteries, even freshly charged. The unit I purchased did not come with an AC Adapter so batteries are the only option. I was able to power on the unit, type my label and hit print but the unit did not have enough power to imprint the label, however it did feed the label material. If you're willing to buy new batteries I think the unit is very nice and easy to navigate, personally I'm just unwilling to use something that can't be powered by reusable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: NicholeL

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine Until It Goes Digital
customer_reviews.text: Used very little--labels for home files and toiletries when traveling. About the fifth use, it started giving a "label jammed" error message, although the label paper was not jammed. Went online and learned that this is an electronic error and tried the suggested fix, which did not work. Contacted the company, which sent me essentially the same suggested fix, which did not work again. When I emailed back that my machine was still not working, did not hear from DYMO again. So customer service is nil, and product is unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: NatchitochesLa

customer_reviews.title: awesome labels! dewdie caca battery! 💩
customer_reviews.text: When this printer was working, I LOVED it. It went through a resting period for about a year and when I came back to do some hardcore labeling, I found that it would not print unless the battery was charged. No problem, I just plugged it in to charge... uh, no. It refuses to charge up again. Searching online for a battery, I found that they go for about $50, whilst I can get a new printer for $40. WTF?! UUGGGHH!!!!! </head asplodes> Oh, btw, this is for the Dyno LabelManager pnp. I read that Amazon merged all of the reviews for all Dyno products, so I can see how that would be a bit confusing for some.
customer_reviews.author: Stagl

customer_reviews.title: Nice but missing some features
customer_reviews.text: I like the layout of the this label maker. But wish it had some of the features that my very old Brother had. The biggest one is to scan through a long label before printing but the biggest is to clear the screen. My old one all you had to do it press the code key and the backspace key at the same time. It erased everything from the screen. The Dymo you have to press and hold the backspace and it is very slow removing characters from the screen. For the money it is a nice L.M.
customer_reviews.author: VSTROMM05

customer_reviews.title: No backlight.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a Professional Organizer so I used a label maker all the time. I was replacing an Epson one I completely wore out. This one is ok. It’s handy and does lots of things but the fact that it has no backlight makes it hard to see what you are typing. I would return it but I waited too late to try it.
customer_reviews.author: LCJ

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to buy the adapter!
customer_reviews.text: I checked around SO LONG to find a good label maker. I read review after review. I finally ordered this one and LOVE IT. Easy to use. I did later buy the adapter for it because it takes 6 batteries without it. Anyway, there is absolutely NO WASTE with the label tape. I say this because SO many reviews of other label makers had numerous complaints about waste of the label tape. This hand-held label maker might not be a fancy keyboard type, but those are the ones that waste tape! A great purchase for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Bakken

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is so easy to use. Has support for 9V power adapter or 6 AAA batteries (neither provided). It comes with 1/2 inch cartridge. It provides plenty of functionalities like changing font & size, add different border and supports clip art.
customer_reviews.author: Nehal

customer_reviews.title: Good product/jams often
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this thing is great. But I nearly went through an entire roll of tape trying to get it going initially. The device kept jamming and crumbling the paper up, resulting in damaged paper and misprint regardless of how many times I took it apart and put it back together. Once it got through half a roll it finally started to want to work.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Great label printer!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a label maker that had a keyboard and it took forever to type/format what I wanted to print. I came across this unit and couldn't be happier. Plug & Play into your computer. The software automatically loads and you can quickly type and format on your computer and then click print. Much faster and easier to use vs a traditional keyboard label maker. Obvious downfall is you need to be connected to your computer to print, therefore slightly less portable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Trust Me The Favorable Reviews Are Wrong
customer_reviews.text: Either the favorable reviews are from another product, or they're plants, or somehow I got two items from DYMO that are defective. Based on the label maker I received, DYMO a horrendously incompetent, or apathetic company. The backing of the DYMO tape this label maker prints onto doesn't peel off, so the labels are useless. Plus, when label maker cuts the tape, it gets trapped inside the device EVERY SINGLE TIME—it's clearly a design flaw. One thing is abundantly clear, it's extremely unlikely DYMO ever bothers to test their products
customer_reviews.author: Nemo

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality labeler and cartridges
customer_reviews.text: Used this to label all newly installed ethernet cabling. Initially everything looked and worked fine, but it has now been a few months with the cables untouched and I started noticing that most labels started falling off, even when sticking two glue sides together. Poor quality, horrible for labeling cabling as they just fall off over time as shown in the picture. Find yourself a better product, one which actually sticks properly and doesn't dry up to a useless piece of paper.
customer_reviews.author: TryingToSurvive

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star Purchase! Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: This Label-Maker is light and fits good in your hand and does not get heavy. It also lays great on a flat surface! the Labels are expensive like most printing devices. Following Links are the Self-Adhesive Cartridge/ Label Cassette!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read LCD screen.
customer_reviews.text: LCD screen is too light and difficult to read - even when adjusted. Comes with case and adapter, which is nice but, falls way short because of the difficult to read LCD screen. Returned without even using.
customer_reviews.author: Kevbo

customer_reviews.title: Only had the pleasure of using it once....Should have kept the Brother P-Touch
customer_reviews.text: So the first time I used this, it was great. However, the unit will not charge. The charging port will not work with the provided charger. I have to physically hold it in place for it to even attempt to charge, even then it may not. The unit is out of the returnable time frame so I guess I will have to consider other options. So far this has been a waste of $65 + the additional cartridges I purchased. I guess I should have kept the Brother P-Touch unit....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but the labels bubble
customer_reviews.text: The labeler was pretty easy to setup but a brighter screen would make it easier, as well as a quick reference for font size. The printing is clear in any font and I like being able to put a border around the words. The one thing I do not like is that the labels bubble if they aren’t placed on a flat surface. (See the pictures above.) Maybe there’s a different kind of label I can use but it seems slightly useless that it will only work on flat surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Alysia

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: I love the utility of this little gem. I can use it just like it is. Plug it in, battery charges while I print my first labels. Took a few minutes after that to download and install the software on my Mac. I was impressed. The software worked with this machine and gave me what I expected. And, if I just want a quick label, I don't plug it into USB on my computer, I just print them out. Definitely my best purchase in label makers in a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: sad sack

customer_reviews.title: Label makers are very cool and this one works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time ever using one of these and I absolutely love it, I thought it would be hard but it’s not. The quality other printing is perfect, I am labeling things in my bathroom cabinet that are in larger containers. I’m also using it in the linen closet to keep the sheets separate sheets separate. I think it’s a valuable thing to have, you can also put your name on an objectThat you don’t want to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality, and stopped charging on first cartridge
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I wanted to print from my laptop, and it worked for a while. The print quality was very poor, but it was convenient and easy to use. In any case, it finally stopped working saying it need charging. I only ever used the original cartridge that came with the printer, and never even managed to use up that first cartridge before it gave up. Plugged into several USB ports, but no charging occurred. Tried 9v battery trick, no luck. It is now in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: SimonA

customer_reviews.title: Nice Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and easy to use label maker and the size of the unit is just right. I've made a bunch of labels since I bought this and it has worked flawlessly for me. Putting new label rolls into the machine is pretty straightforward. The only thing it's missing is a Clear Button when you want to type in a new label. You have to backspace to delete the old text. It's a minor inconvenience that you get used to.
customer_reviews.author: JayKK

customer_reviews.title: Useless Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to label Cat5 jacks and so I wouldn't have to keep buying batteries for my other labelers. Charged on Sunday night, and on Tuesday I pulled it out and it was stone dead, Luckily had power but had to wait 15 minutes for it to "charge" before I could print out a label.. That night I let it charge overnight again and pulled it out again on Friday to use - same thing - dead as a doornail. No power at this location - had to use my other battery powered labeler (PTOUCH) this time (it works but sucks batteries)
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and convenient
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me and you like to keep your life organized, this is a must! i like to keep a label on my perfumes to remember how long I've hoarded them (lol), but I imagine this would be great for people who enjoy journaling, or people who want to keep their kitchen jars in order. The interface is simple and very easy to use. Replacements are cheap. I have no complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: LuvLuvLuv my Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: What this IS: A great little tool to get organized! I'm using to label things for my daughter's wedding and tubs in our storage room. Screen is big enough to see! What this is NOT: A computer! Don't worry about it being too technical. It's quite intuitive and easy to use with nice on-screen prompts. I glanced at the included instructions but really didn't need them. No huge user manual here either -- just an easy-to-use guide that is small and simple. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: SueChef

customer_reviews.title: Battery Acid
customer_reviews.text: This uses 6 AAA batteries. I have had this product for 2 months and the whole inside has gone bad due to the battery acid. (My batteries were brand new before I used them) I replaced the batteries and now it won’t work. This is ridiculous. This didn’t get wet at all either so I’m not sure why this is happening. I loved this labeler until this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Jayde Gorder

customer_reviews.title: Can’t stop, won’t stop.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve become a labeling monster in my house after purchasing this. I label everything! No more excuse from my husband that he doesn’t know where anything is. — I’ve used other label makers before, but this one was very easy to use, and a plus is the simplicity of inserting a new cartridge. I do agree about the printing and how it does leave a significant amount of space before and after the words; however what I do in situations like that is type up everything I want to print at once so it comes out as one large label for me to cut in pieces rather than printing each item individually.
customer_reviews.author: Lysa

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this labeler to use in my garden. So far the labels have lasted through the rain. I do not know the durability through the winter. Hopefully, everything stays. The one and two-line printing works well. The only problem I have is the label will jam when printing. The way I have gotten around this is to not cut the previous label until I am ready to print the second label, annoying but it works. Not worth the hassle to return.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Avoid dymo at all costs
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, it broke in less than three months and I purchased the extra warranty and could not get it replaced. Initially it worked fine but after three months it was toast. I tried phoning them, no answer. I emailed them multiple times, probably over a dozen times and they didn't respond. I even tried writing them on their social media with no response. The warranty did me no good. Even with the warranty, I strongly advise to avoid this label maker at all cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: junk labels. good label maker.
customer_reviews.text: This would have gotten 5 stars because the label maker itself is great, but the label material that comes with it wont even stay stuck to itself when placed back-to-back with both sticky sides touching. I like my labels to look like flags that I can read on either side, but I came back the next day to find they had all fallen off the wires onto the floor. If you are going to stick them to a wire length-wise and use transparent heat-shrink over them then they would probably work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carchick

customer_reviews.title: EASY PEASY
customer_reviews.text: In the past, label makers required a masters degree, especially that heavy monstrosity that was bright yellow. Even with an manual, it was impossible. Thankfully, this DYMO baby could not be easier. I got ours for a paltry $20 on some kind of Amazon sale, and at any price, this one is absolutely worth every penny. I didn't even need to read the booklet, just played around with this for 10 minutes. If you're in the market for a quality label maker, this is it. I'd buy this over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Newporter57Top Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: Most important tool in my bag
customer_reviews.text: Works great, interface is easy enough to use. It doesn't have a ton of features, and the display is one line only, but it makes due and does what I need it to do. Have been able to adequately label all my IT jobs and ethernet runs. The tape included isn't great for wrapping ethernet cables however. Instead, find a label maker that uses a thicker, almost fabric type of tape.
customer_reviews.author: K and D

customer_reviews.title: Defective Workmanship from DYMO Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: DYMO Label maker arrived when expected. It was professionally packaged by the manufacturer and seemed brand new, as expected. Upon unpacking item I loaded the tape and batteries and created a name label to attach to the label maker. As I did, I noticed defects to the body of the label maker. Holes manufactured deep in the frame appear in at least 2 places around the edges of the label maker. I attach several photos with my review.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra T.

customer_reviews.title: You can connect it directly to your computer so you dont need the onboard keyboard :)
customer_reviews.text: I specifically chose this one so I would not have to use my thumbs to type in lables. The sofware isnt so great but I can work around it. I recommend buying the OEM cartridges. I have some genericc replacments and they dont stick as well. I've had to use superglue on some of them. But the original DYMO labels stick nicely. Get the case for it too so you can keep it all together and not lose the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Heber Cloward

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always wanted a label printer, but the ones at local staples is always overpriced.... after getting this label printer, I was having a lot of fun labeling all my tools..... great buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bibi

customer_reviews.title: Unique essential battery
customer_reviews.text: When the W003688 battery (magnification required to read 3 point label) dies unexpectedly a replacement costs more than half the price of a whole new printer. This label maker installs as a printer on your system and shows up as an option when printing a full, multi-page document. When you happen to select it by accident be ready to scramble. The dead battery should be individually wrapped, placed in a sealed plastic bag, and delivered to a place that has given pre approval for recycling. While it works it makes good looking labels.
customer_reviews.author: Manong John

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced junk, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. It worked really well until half the cartridge was finished, then it just printed part of the words. I thought it was the printer cartridge, so I purchased another one at $12.00 a cartridge, and it still didn't work. It also kept giving a low battery signal, and no matter what kind of new batteries I put in, it still have a low battery symbol. Piece of junk, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: The bomb-diggity for organization
customer_reviews.text: Super intuitive to use, a steal for the price. Having uniformly labelled files is so much easier on the eye, and on the brain (especially when you have a couple cabinets of them!). Definitely a good investment, especially at this price point. My one recommendation is to order refill cartridges along with the label maker - the 10 ft sample size it arrives with doesn't last long!
customer_reviews.author: Lalalalaleesa

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't work. Power wouldn't come on & started burning/melting the batteries. Waste of 12 AAA batteries and I am NOT happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sherrard

customer_reviews.title: Label Everything
customer_reviews.text: I was tempted to label everything in my house, but the tape refills aren't free. This is a handy label maker that can operate on its own or with a computer and software. Quality and speed are fine, but sometimes the labels have trouble sticking to things. This unit uses a rechargeable battery pack but has an on board charger, so it charges with just a DC adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Requires battery???  That is completely dead months after purchase, and costs more to replace than the entire unit.
customer_reviews.text: Just as some other reviewers here say: I couldn't get the printer to turn on. Checked the cable. Popped it open. I was surprised to find a battery in inside, to be honest. Why does it need a battery? It plugs in to USB...you can't run it without USB. So it appears the battery is completely dead. And a quick look online shows that new batteries cost around $30, more than the cost of the printer itself. How pathetic. I hate that companies sell such low quality products. I honestly think there should be some kind of environmental fine for manufacturing garbage like this. It's just a complete waste. Honestly, it's disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating software means I could not  print from a laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model vs others for it's laptop connectivity. I was trying to avoid typing on the Dymo keyboard and just copy / paste into the dymo label software on my laptop. The software or hardware is lousy and would not recognize the correct label size in the printer. Reported that my label size @ 12mm didn't match the label in the printer @ 12mm and therefore would not print. That's right, 12 is not equal to 12 in dymo-math. WTH? Works fine if you like to type on the printer's keyboard. I can't comment on batter life. Maybe just a one off issue.
customer_reviews.author: David Cole

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my older LetraTag label maker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 160 to replace my 10 year old label maker. So far I am very happy with my purchase. The extras this model has that my older one does not are very welcome. My only complaint is the amount of label media that gets wasted with every label you print. There is far too much label being wasted at each end of the label you print. I found a way to get around this with my older label maker by pushing the tape back into the cartridge before printing the next label. So far I haven't had much success at doing this with the new label maker.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker. Simple to use and it doesn't waste your labels. Comes with a 10 foot label cartridge, replacement cartridges are 23 foot. Several colors are available. Comes with a rechargeable Li-ion battery that recharges in about three hours. You can hook it up to your computer, download the label software and print directly from your computer. The label maker has its own program. The download software gives you a ton of more options for printing. The printed label pops right out and is easy to peel the backing off. You will like it so much you'll start looking for things to label.
customer_reviews.author: rod

customer_reviews.title: Better than others but...
customer_reviews.text: It beats the other brands and doesn’t waste as much ribbon as they do. It’s got plenty of choices but the small things like a shift button isn’t there and the display could be bigger
customer_reviews.author: CMD925

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, it's faulty
customer_reviews.text: The appearance looks good, but strait out of the box the tape would not feed through the top. Huge dissapointment. I needed this to label school stuff, and should've ordered a label maker sooner bc this one put me behind!
customer_reviews.author: Laura W.

customer_reviews.title: Need bigger hands to hold it.
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version for over ten years. This functions really well! Easy to use, nice options... but it is so much bigger. For me, it is a little too big to hold in both hands and type with my thumbs, if I hold it with one hand, then it takes me forever to type with the other. Oh, and it takes six AAA batteries. Other than that, it works flawlessly! The keyboard functions are easy to use, the labels are easy to read. It's just a touchy-feely thing for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Guerierri

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing tape, but nice machine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first Dymo label maker in about 1962, sold kids their name on labels (until the school principal confiscated my label 'gun). I've owned many units over the past 55 years, never been disappointed, until now. Every label I've made with the "demo" tape has curled up and become unattached. I prepare the surfaces before attaching, it's just bad or 'aged' adhesive, very disappointing. I have 4 Brother units but bought the ole standby again, I've ordered more tape, and hope it's better, as it couldn't be worse. Three stars for the machine, none for the tape.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Easy to Use Label Maker - Does NOT Come with Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Does a quality job printing labels and is pretty easy to use. Doesn't come with batteries so make sure you have some on hand you will be frustrated. Luckily I read it in the description before I checked out, but honestly they should include it. One annoying feature is deleting all your characters before making a new label, subtracted a star for that and the no batteries thing.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Good Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have used other label makers but so far this one is the best one I have used. I would have given it a 5 star rating in all areas if they would have put a clear button on it. Other Dymo label printers I have used had a clear button on it so you could clear the printer instead of using and holding the back button down. Maybe on the next generation they will add a clear button on it.
customer_reviews.author: RLow

customer_reviews.title: Screen Contrast is Dim
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived new and is packaged extremely well. Like all things that come in sealed plastic blister cases, it was like wrestling an alligator to remove the thing! For all intents and purposes, it is exactly what I needed. However, there seems to be something wrong with the display screen. The contrast is very light, and I can barely see what is being typed on the screen. It is difficult to see all of the prompts for settings too. I did buy the adapter to plug in rather than use batteries and have not tried batteries to see if that makes a difference. Has anyone else had this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Sharna Campos

product_meta.title: DYMO LabelManager 500TS Full-Colour Touch Screen Label Maker with PC or Mac Connection (1790417)
product_meta.description:
Puts labeling power at your fingertips. Just tap the full-color touch screen to change fonts, format text, add graphics and much more. Connect to PC or Mac and use DYMO Label Software to customize labels with fonts or graphics - even download labels for editing and printing on the go. 10 font styles, 25 font sizes, 32 text styles, 5 boxes plus underline, and 325 built-in symbols and clip-art images. Includes rechargeable battery pack, USB cable, and 1 DYMO D1 1 black-on-white label cassette. Uses Dymo D1 labels in 1/4-, 3/8-, 1/2-, and 1-inch widths.

Compatible with Windows 7 or later and Mac OS X v10.8 or later. Microsoft and Windows are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries. Mac and OS X are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
feature_bullets: Puts labeling power at your fingertips -just tap the full-color touch screen to change fonts, format text, add graphics and much more
Connect to PC or Mac* and use DYMO Label Software to customize labels with fonts or graphics - even download labels for editing and printing on the go
Portable label maker's powerful lithium-ion battery charges quickly and lasts long. Computer-style (QWERTY) keyboard
Store and quickly access over 500 frequently -used labels for up to 5 different users, 10 font styles at 25 sizes, 32 text styles, 5 boxes plus underline, and 325 built-in symbols and clip-art images
Compatible with DYMO D1 labels in 1/4", 3/8", 1/2", 3/4", and 1" wide in a variety of colors
Includes: LabelManager 500TS Label Maker, D1 Starter Label Black on White, 1" x 10', Rechargeable Battery Pack, Charging Adapter, USB Cable, Quick Start and Reference Guides, 1-Year Limited Warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars31 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
